block.p: An article on Tuesday about the World Bank's consideration of an oil pipeline in Africa referred incorrectly to a recent report by the bank on African poverty. The study concluded that Africans were poorer than 40 years ago and that a share of the blame belonged to the bank and the International Monetary Fund. But the contention that the two organizations had made the continent poorer through failed lending policies came from recent Washington demonstrators, not from the study.
